name: E. Serval and Modulo
statement:
There is an array a consisting of n non-negative integers and a k (k
ge 1, k is an integer). Serval has constructed another array b of length
n, where b_i = a_i
bmod k holds^{
text{ }} for all 1
leq i
leq n. Then, he b.You are given the two arrays a and b. Find a possible
k. However, there is a small possibility that Serval fooled you, and
such an integer does not exist. In this case, output -1.It can be shown
that, under the constraints of the problem, if such an integer k exists,
then there exists a valid answer no more than 10^9. And you need to
guarantee that k
le 10^9 in your output.^{
text{ }}a_i
bmod k denotes the remainder from dividing a_i by k.
